Notes: The Cobb Memorial Archives was established in 1976 to collect source material on the history of Chambers County, Alabama, and the surrounding area, including West Point, Georgia.  The archives building serves as headquarters for the Chattahoochee Valley Historical Society, whose collection of documents and artifacts forms a major part of the archives.  Holdings total approximately 700 cubic feet of still pictures, manuscripts, organizational records, newspapers, maps, and printed materials.  The construction of West Point Dam, native Creek inhabitants, local mills and villages, and the experiences of local World War II veterans are among the subjects documented. Records include those of the Fort Tyler Chapter of the United Daughters of the Confederacy and the Chattahoochee Chapter of the Daughters of the American RevolutioN
Source of Repository Data: Alabama Department of Archives and History
